_header: All the trespass of my tender youth
Note: The first stanza also appears as the concluding stanza in ‘Eight Verses of Bernard:’ see 4051.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Prayer in Old Age’ — four 8-line stanzas

BodHat73.First Lines:
All the trespas of my tendre youthWith grevous gyltes rekenyd of
                    yonge age…
BodHat73.Last Lines:
…Thy blode thy passioun graunte me for a signeMercifull ihesu
                    to patyse my passages
BodHat73.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 20-1.

Lam344.First Lines:
All the trespace of my tender youtheWyth greuous gyltes rekened of
                    yonge age…

…Thy blode thy passyon graunt me for a sygneMercyfull ihesu to
